LA.SETTINGS.debug.label: Verbose Debugging
LA.SETTINGS.mech.enableEffects.label: Enable Mech Sheet Effects
LA.SETTINGS.mech.enableEffects.subLabel: Enable the display of CSS effects such as animations and drop shadows in mech sheets.
LA.SETTINGS.mech.enableTooltip.label: Enable Mech Sheet Tooltips
LA.SETTINGS.mech.enableTooltip.subLabel: Enable display of non-essential tooltips in mech sheets.
LA.SETTINGS.mech.enableHeaderLog.label: Enable Mech Sheet Header Log
LA.SETTINGS.mech.enableHeaderLog.subLabe: Enable Typed.js & TypeIt.js display in mech sheet headers. This can help with performance if disabled.
Enable Mech Sheet Action Log in Sidebar
Enable the action log to be displayed in the mech sheet's sidebar in its own tab.
LA.SETTINGS.mech.enableMainActionLog.lab: Enable Mech Sheet Action Log in Status Tab
LA.SETTINGS.mech.enableMainActionLog.sub: Enable the action log to be displayed in the mech sheet's status tab.
LA.SETTINGS.mech.sizeMainActionLog.label: Mech Sheet Action Log Max Height
LA.SETTINGS.mech.sizeMainActionLog.subLa: Set the maximum height of the action log in the status tab. This has no effect in the sidebar, as it always takes up the entire height there. The unit size is in root element size (rem).
LA.SETTINGS.mech.saveCollapse.label: Mech Sheet Action Log Save States
LA.SETTINGS.mech.saveCollapse.subLabel: Save the collapsed state of the action log in the mech sheet to persist through rerenders.
LA.SETTINGS.mech.startCollapsed.label: Mech Sheet Action Log Content Starts Collapsed
LA.SETTINGS.mech.startCollapsed.subLabel: Set the content of the action log in the mech sheet to start collapsed.
LA.SETTINGS.npc.enableTooltip.label: Enable NPC Sheet Tooltips
LA.SETTINGS.npc.enableTooltip.subLabel: Enable display of non-essential tooltips in NPC sheets.
LA.SETTINGS.npc.sheetWidth.label: NPC Sheet Default Width
LA.SETTINGS.npc.sheetWidth.subLabel: Set the width of the NPC sheet. The unit size is in pixels (px).
LA.SETTINGS.npc.sheetHeight.label: NPC Sheet Default Height
LA.SETTINGS.npc.sheetHeight.subLabel: Set the height of the NPC sheet. The unit size is in pixels (px).
LA.SETTINGS.npc.saveCollapse.label: NPC Sheet Action Log Save States
LA.SETTINGS.npc.saveCollapse.subLabel: Save the collapsed state of the action log in the NPC sheet to persist through rerenders.
LA.SETTINGS.npc.startCollapsed.label: NPC Sheet Action Log Content Starts Collapsed
LA.SETTINGS.npc.startCollapsed.subLabel: Set the content of the action log in the NPC sheet to start collapsed.
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableEffects.label: Enable Pilot Sheet Effects
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableEffects.subLabel: Enable the display of CSS effects such as animations and drop shadows in mech sheets.
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableTooltip.label: Enable Pilot Sheet Tooltips
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableTooltip.subLabel: Enable display of non-essential tooltips in mech sheets.
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableHeaderLog.label: Enable Pilot Sheet Header Log
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableHeaderLog.subLab: Enable Typed.js & TypeIt.js display in mech sheet headers. This can help with performance if disabled.
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableSidebarActionLog: Enable Pilot Sheet Action Log in Sidebar
Enable the action log to be displayed in the mech sheet's sidebar in its own tab.
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.saveCollapse.label: Pilot Sheet Action Log Save States
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.saveCollapse.subLabel: Save the collapsed state of the action log in the pilot sheet to persist through rerenders.
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.startCollapsed.label: Pilot Sheet Action Log Content Starts Collapsed
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.startCollapsed.subLabe: Set the content of the action log in the pilot sheet to start collapsed.
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableSensors.label: Enable Pilot Sheet Sensors
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableSensors.subLabel: Enable the display of the sensors stat in pilot sheets.
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableTechAttack.label: Enable Pilot Sheet Tech Attack
LA.SETTINGS.pilot.enableTechAttack.subLa: Enable the display of the tech attack stat in pilot sheets.
LA.SETTINGS.deployable.enableTooltip.sub: Enable display of non-essential tooltips in Deployable sheets.
LA.SETTINGS.deployable.sheetWidth.label: Deployable Sheet Default Width
LA.SETTINGS.deployable.sheetWidth.subLab: Set the width of the Deployable sheet. The unit size is in pixels (px).
LA.SETTINGS.deployable.sheetHeight.label: Deployable Sheet Default Height
LA.SETTINGS.deployable.sheetHeight.subLa: Set the height of the Deployable sheet. The unit size is in pixels (px).
LA.SETTINGS.deployable.saveCollapse.labe: Deployable Sheet Action Log Save States
LA.SETTINGS.deployable.saveCollapse.subL: Save the collapsed state of the action log in the Deployable sheet to persist through rerenders.
LA.SETTINGS.deployable.startCollapsed.la: Deployable Sheet Action Log Content Starts Collapsed
LA.SETTINGS.deployable.startCollapsed.su: Set the content of the action log in the Deployable sheet to start collapsed.

LA.activate.tooltip: The amount of activations this character has per round

LA.description.label: DESCRIPTION
LA.detail.label: DETAILS
LA.rank.label: RANK
LA.limited.label: USES
LA.limited.tooltip: Consume a limited use of this weapon/system
LA.loaded.label: LOADED
LA.loaded.tooltip: The loaded state of this weapon/system
LA.armor.label: ARMOR
LA.armor.tooltip:
Armor reduces all incoming damage to HP from a single source by an amount equal to its rating, unless stated otherwise (such as Burn and AP)

Armor can reduce damage to 0, has a limit of 4, and resolves after the Exposed status and before Resistance
LA.edefense.tooltip: E-Defense determines the threshold needed to hit a target with a Tech Attack and other electronically guided systems (such as Seeking)
LA.evasion.tooltip: Evasion determines the threshold needed to hit a target with a ranged or melee attack
LA.tattack.tooltip: Tech Attack is used in place of Grit when making a Tech Attack or conducting electronic warfare
LA.sensor.tooltip:
Sensors is the maximum distance from the edge of a character's space that they can detect enemies, make tech attacks, and use electronic systems

They are aware of all other characters within their sensor range so long as those characters are not hiding, even if there is no direct line-of-sight
LA.save.tooltip: Save Target determines the threshold needed to resist an effect being caused by this character when it forces another character to make a save
LA.hitpoint.tooltip:
Hit Points are the amount of damage the current Structure threshold can resist before being destroyed

Any excess damage carries over to the next Structure threshold
LA.overshield.tooltip:
Overshields provide Hit Points that disappears at the end of the scene or as determined by the source. A character can only have a single instance of Overshield, retaining the highest value

When damage is received, Overshield is reduced before HP when it is active and resolves the same way as HP
LA.structure.label: STRUCT
LA.structure.tooltip: Structure is the amount of damage a character can take before being destroyed. When their HP is reduced to 0, they take Structure damage and roll the Structure Damage Table
LA.heat.label: HEAT
LA.heat.tooltip:
Heat is the amount of thermal strain the current Stress threshold can resist before overheating. Heat ignores Armor but can be resisted

Any excess heat carries over to the next Stress threshold. Biological characters take energy damage in place of heat
LA.stress.label: STRESS
LA.stress.tooltip: Stress is the amount of heat a character can take before their internals undergo meltdown. When a character exceeds their heat capacity, they roll the Overheating Table
LA.burn.label: BURN
LA.burn.tooltip:
Burn is a special damage that ignores armor but can be resisted

Characters that receive Burn damage must take the amount received and add it to their current Burn value. At the end of their turn characters roll an Engineering check to clear the accumulated Burn, or take the accumulated Burn as damage

LA.info.label: INFO

LA.repair.tooltip: The number of Repairs this mech has that can be used to regain HP or fix structure, mounts, and systems
LA.overcharge.tooltip: The current stage of overcharge this character will roll when taking the Overcharge action
LA.speed.label: speed
LA.speed.tooltip:
The amount of space this character can cover on a standard move or when they Boost

Movement can be split between actions, but actions taken must fully resolve before continuing to move. Continuing to move after resolving an action is considered starting movement again
LA.size.label: size
LA.size.tooltip:
The effective size of this character including their area of control

Characters can move through spaces occupied by obstructions a smaller size than them, allied characters are never obstructions, and mechs are not obstructed by organics of their same size. No character can end movement in a space occupied by a character or object unless specified

LA.action.full.label: FULL ACTION
LA.action.full.tooltip: Full actions can be used to make an improvised attack, skill check, barrage, full tech, disengage, stabilize, boot up, mount/dismount, or activate an appropriate system
LA.action.quick.label: QUICK ACTION
LA.action.quick.tooltip: Quick actions can be used to boost, skirmish, grapple, ram, quick tech, hide, search, eject, prepare, shut down, self-destruct, or activate an appropriate system
LA.action.reaction.label: REACTION
LA.action.reaction.tooltip: Reactions can be made outside of the turn order as a response to a trigger and a character can only take one reaction per turn, up to any amount per round
LA.action.free.label: FREE ACTION
LA.action.free.tooltip: Free actions can be used at any time during a turn and can be used to take an action more than once per turn
LA.action.protocol.label: PROTOCOL
LA.action.protocol.tooltip: Protocols are free actions that must be activated at the beginning of the turn
LA.action.invade.label: INVADE
LA.action.invade.tooltip: Invasions are tech attacks against a character within sensors and line-of-sight that inflict 2 Heat and the effects of an invasion option available to this character. Allied and willing targets are automatically invaded, do not take heat, and are not considered attacked
LA.action.quickTech.label: QUICK TECH
LA.action.quickTech.tooltip: Quick techs can be used to bolster, scan, lock on, or invade with Fragment Signal or another invasion option
LA.action.fullTech.label: FULL TECH
LA.action.fullTech.tooltip: Full techs can be used to make two quick techs or activate another system that require a full tech to activate
LA.action.overcharge.label: OVERCHARGE
LA.action.move.label: MOVE
LA.action.endofturn.label: END OF TURN
LA.action.startofturn.label: START OF TURN

LA.pilot.fluff.1: Improper use of this IDENT record and/or its constituent data by the record holder or any other persons is punishable under the DoJ/HR A-645-c. This record is the property of the Union Administrative Office and the information herein must be transmitted on request under NDL-C-DISCORDANT-BREATH encryption protocols. This RM-4 record must be updated every five (5) Cradle Standard Years of objective time to retain GMS licensing rights. Far-field operatives that anticipate deployments lasting longer than five Cradle Standard Years that have not been issued a man-portable Omninet Hook should apply for the RM-11-B IDENT Supplemental (b) Extension. Contact your local Union Adminstrative Officer for any other matters regarding this record.	V-CDL//M-265-114-831 (A)
LA.pilot.isOwner.label: FULLY AUTHORIZED
LA.pilot.isLimited.label: READ-ONLY
LA.pilot.hitpoint.tooltip:
Hit Points are the amount of damage the a pilot can take before they must roll a 1d6 to determine the consequences of their injuries

On a 6, the pilot returns to 1 HP and on a 1 they immediately die. On 2-5 the pilot gains the Down and Out as well as the Stunned status and remain at 0 HP, with any additional damage liable to kill the pilot. If the pilot is in a mech, the mech gains the Stunned status and their Evasion is reduced to 5
LA.pilot.stress.tooltip:
Stress is the amount of physical and mental strain on a pilot. When a pilot exceeds their stress capacity, they gain a Burden, clear all stress, and is taken out of the narrative scene

A pilot can have a maximum of 3 Burdens and a pilot that exceeds their Stress capacity while already having 3 Burdens only clear 2 Stress for themselves and inflicts 1 stress to the all other pilots. A Burden can be healed as a Downtime Action by rolling a skill check with varying efficacy and pilots can engage in healing another's Burden

LA.deployable.hitpointMax.tooltip:
Maximum Hit Points are the maximum amount of damage that an object such as terrain, cover, buildings, and deployable items can take before being destroyed

An object typically has 10 HP per Size, unless stated otherwise
